title: Saving/moving current firefox data - cookies, passwords, bookmarks etc. 2 new computer
content: I am lost. The articles in Mozilla Support explaining how to backup and migrate my current account , after reading them, just gave me a headache. Can someone explain (in plain english) please, how I can save my passwords, bookmarks and cookies that Firefox has associated with my 8 year old Win 10 Pro desktop so I can transfer that data to a new Win 11 Pro desktop. Any and all suggestions will greatly be appreciated. Firefox and I have been running together since 2004! Thank you, The Old Guy
creator: fulcrcl73-01

title: Firefox suddenly stopped working
content: So yesterday I connected my pc to different internet provider and suddenly a few apps, like Firefox, MS Office programms, Adobe Acrobat stopped working. In the past I had only issue with firefox and flushing dns with winsock resetting did the job but not this time. Firefox wont launch in any way. Can someone provide a solution for this? Thank you.
creator: sushi5005wot

title: Need help migrating Firefox to my new computer
content: Over the years I've migrated my Firefox profile from one computer to the next, but this time, I cannot make it work. I tried copying the contents of the old profile folder from my old computer into the new profile folder, the one with name ending in 'default user', which I confirmed was the one being used by looking in 'about:profile'. That has worked for me in the past, and it seemed to have worked for other users posting in this form. However, that did not work; Firefox still opened as if it was a fresh installation with none of my bookmarks, etc. Then I compared the 2 folders and found there were over 900 files in the new folder that were not in the old folder. So I deleted everything in the new profile and pasted the contents of the old profile in so they matched exactly. It still did not work. I welcome suggestions!
creator: drdownes1

title: How to get to support forum?
content: Posted a question, received email reply, but doesn't appear to be any way to access forum posts directly. Support area is very poorly organized, mostly just links to boilerplate articles. I've been doing support for SMF over 10 years and seen some bad installs, but nothing as awful as this.

creator: gegabbert

title: Link behavior- new tab versus opening in existing tab
content:
I have looked at dozens of support Q and A's and have not been able to figure out how to get links to work how I think they should.

If I click on a link in a tab that opens another site I want that to open a new tab. If I click on a link that goes to a a page on the current website I want it to be in the same tab. If I click on a link in an external program then I want that to be a new tab.

I have played around with about:config settings for browser.link (there are 6) using info found here and elsewhere and no combination I have tried does what I think should happen every time. Some websites do act correctly but others pretty soon have many open tabs when all I was doing was trying to navigate the site.

I even tried the "Open link with new tab" plugin and it doesn't do what it says it can do (I have checked "Open a link to a different site on a tab").

Anyone know how to get Firefox to do what I think is the obvious way to handle it?
creator: mk869

title: All browser audio popping
content: Regardless of where the audio is coming from, the audio plays back choppy and popping. I've already both reset and reinstalled multiple times to no avail. I thought may maybe it was my computer audio, but everything else works perfectly fine, with Firefox being the only thing with popping audio. I'm now out of ideas of what it could be, as is only started today.
creator: shadowthynightwing

title: Full screen mode broke firefox
content: I have been a huge fan of Firefox browser for many years. Unfortunately, today I had to make the hard decision to remove Firefox and start learning a new browser. Suddenly, each time I load Firefox (which is daily), I find that my menu bar is gone and when I try to move the window between screens, i can no longer click and drag the window at the top of the screen, as it is frozen in place. I have tried exiting the window through the menu exit command, as some have suggested that Firefox should remember that setting. However, it is not remembering that setting. I am constantly having to hit F11 multiple times every day and I have not once, ever gone in and enabled full screen mode. This setting is being forced on me. I constantly keep finding it is back in full screen and have to undo it. Several of my friends have been experiencing the same problem and are equally upset at this major break in what was a flawless system. Nobody understands why this is not a feature which can be freely turned on/off.
creator: DJVoorman

title: Bad interaction between sync / restore and Default Bookmark Folder by Teddy Gustiaux
content:
Really bad day, I turned on some Ubuntu 22.04 machine I hadn't used in about six months and the next thing I notice is my bookmarks are completely thrashed. I attempt several restores after that and every time the bookmarks still look completely messed up.

Completely resigned to my fate I decide to disable Firefox extensions in a last effort to get back my precious bookmarks to a sane state and after that things look like they are supposed to (mostly).
creator: jptettamanti

title: Firefox Sync - export synchronizovaných panelů
content:
Zdravím.

Synchronizuji androidí mobil skrze FF Sync s win počítačem. Mobil se poškodil, musel jsem ho reinstalovat, panely/taby z jeho FF zmizely. (Mimochodem nepředpokládám, že by šly do mobilu nahrát zpátky? Třeba že bych ve FF Syncu přihlásil mobil pod stejným názvem, jako byl předtím, a panely by se nahrály? Spíš se bojím, že by je to ze Syncu smazalo)

Situace tedy je, že je mám je v počítači v ,,Synchronizovaných panelech".

Hledám možnost, jak je nějak zpracovat. Bohužel jich je velké množství na možnost ,,Otevřít vše v panelech" - FF spadne (v tomhle byla stará Opera mnohem stabilnější). Můžu je otevírat po jednom, jenomže taby nejdou v ,,Synchronizovaných panelech" zavírat (nebo jakkoliv označovat), takže se časem ztratím v tom, kde jsem skončil.

Nejsou ty linky třeba v nějakém souboru v profilu FF, ze kterého bych se je pokusil vytáhnout?
creator: frohlich.tomas

title: Excessive RAM use while restoring window
content:
Is there a way to restore a window using less RAM, or if applicable, with regular garbage collection during the process?

While restoring a previously closed window, significantly more RAM is used than when reopening a session, for the same amount of tabs. So if the window ever gets closed and that state saved, I need to revert to a previous session backup. Attempting to restore the window caused ram usage to go up to 30 gigabytes and beyond, at which point I stopped the process out of caution. In contrast reopening the browser with the tabs normally is only about 5 gigabytes.

I regularly use Firefox with thousands of tabs open. This is usually not an issue but in some cases leads to performance issues like these.
creator: oSpre

title: Fullscreen bugs when I switch to desktop
content:
For example, when I open a YouTube video on fullscreen, go to the desktop by pressing Win + D, and return to Firefox by pressing Win + D, the video is no longer on fullscreen, but my tabs and taskbar are invisible. It happens on every site with fullscreen, regardless of whether I watch video or play a web game.

I already tried to go into troubleshooting mode, but it did nothing. I also tried to remove fullscreen animation, but nothing again.

How to fix this bug?

title: Opening links in Outlook 2021 emails (not outlook.com) resets Firefox theme to default and disables extensions
content:
Hey guys! 

    I'm running Win 10pro, Microsoft Office Pro Plus 2021 and Firefox X64.  I set Firefox as the default browser, but for some reason that setting isn't "sticking."  If Edge is installed, I can't find it.  Believe me, I tried, because I wanted to uninstall it if possible.

I'm still getting used to the new Outlook (I won't tell you what version I WAS using...) but this is throwing me for a loop...

If I do not have Firefox open: When I open a link in Outlook, a new window is opened in Firefox. This window does not include any toolbars nor are any of my customizations applied (themes, extensions) As a matter of fact, opening the link in this new bare-bones window disables all my extensions and if I want my theme back, I have to remove it from my theme manager and reinstall it, because the option to enable/disable the theme isn't there.

If I DO have Firefox open: When I open a link in Outlook, I get "Firefox is already running, but is not responding. The old Firefox process must be closed to open a new window." If I close Firefox, I'll get that same bare-bones window and all my extensions and themes are disabled.

Has anyone seen anything like this before and can you help?

Thanks a bunch....
creator: demutthaus
